Kis.RejectPendant: Am I supposed to eat that?$3
BETAS.Kis.Monday_0: Hard dough makes biscuits, soft dough makes cookies.
BETAS.Kis.Monday_1: This is part of my thesis research.
Kis.Monday_0: There is a scientific distinction between dough that uses water and dough that uses a syrup phase of sugar to affect its texture.
Kis.Monday_1: A running habit in my program was that those of us whose thesis are focused on end product development share leftover samples as snacks during lab hours.#$b#Testing would take so -=()ing long and require one hundred percent attention that we just don't have enough time to go out and buy snacks.
Kis.Monday_2: In my research period I'm known as the one guy who people actively flock to for leftovers.
Kis.Monday_3: I don't share the high thickener concentration samples because they feel like chewing on rubber sandals.
BETAS.Kis.Tuesday_0: Assuming burnt bread has 100 micrograms of acrylamide.
BETAS.Kis.Tuesday_1: You would need to eat anywhere between 10-20kg of burnt bread at once to die of acrylamide poisoning.
BETAS.Kis.Tuesday_2: By which point you would sooner die to a ruptured stomach than that.
BETAS.Kis.Tuesday_3: Additionally, dietary acrylamide is very unlikely to cause cancer in tias.
Kis.Tuesday_0: Ages ago, I did a research on special snacks... where I had to make twenty -=()ing five samples in triplicate PLUS confirmation tests.#$b#They were good snacks, but they were too MANY of them, so I gave my taste-testers 'complimentary treats'.#$b#Even so, they keep piling up between testing... and at one point I was like... please... -=()ing take them. I can't stand seeing these snacks anymore.
Kis.Tuesday_3: Bread contains lots of sugars and amino acids.#$b#Which produce acrylamide when burnt.#$b#So that's bad, but it's not like you'll get instant mega cancer for eating one (1) piece of coal bread.
